oracle.pg.rdbms

Class OraclePropertyGraphUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.common.OracleConvertersUtilsBase
      • oracle.pg.common.OraclePropertyGraphUtilsBase
        • oracle.pg.rdbms.OraclePropertyGraphUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    oracle.pg.common.messages.MesgConsts

    public class OraclePropertyGraphUtils
extends OraclePropertyGraphUtilsBase
    This class contains utility functions to help manage property graphs stored in an Oracle Database.

        public static boolean checkSnapshotExist(java.lang.String szGraphName,
                                         java.lang.String tableOwner,
                                         java.sql.Connection conn,
                                         long lSnapshotID)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method returns TRUE if a particular snapshot exists for a given property graph
        Parameters:
        szGraphName - the graph name where to get the snapshot
        tableOwner - the owner of the snapshot table
        conn - an Oracle connection
        lSnapshotID - the ID of the snapshot to write
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • cloneGraph

        public static void cloneGraph(java.sql.Connection conn,
                              java.lang.String szOrgGraphName,
                              java.lang.String szNewGraphName,
                              int iDOP,
                              int iNumSubPtns,
                              java.lang.String szTBS,
                              java.lang.String szOptions)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method makes a clone of a given graph.
        Parameters:
        conn - a JDBC connection to Oracle Database
        szOrgGraphName - name of the original graph
        szNewGraphName - name of the new graph
        iDOP - degree of parallelism
        iNumSubPtns - number of sub partitions to be used for the new graph. Has to be a positive integer (and a power of 2)
        szTBS - name of the tablespace to be used for the new graph
        szOptions - options to be passed on to the underlying PL/SQL API.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • copyGraph

        public static void copyGraph(Oracle oracle,
                             java.lang.String graphName,
                             java.lang.String newGraphName)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.Exception
        Copy the property graph (including its associated tables) to the specified graph name (if it is not empty). This operation will not copy existing indices into the new graph.
        Parameters:
        oracle - an Oracle connection to the database where the property graph is stored.
        graphName - the name of the property graph to be copied
        newGraphName - the new name of the graph
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • copyGraph

        public static void copyGraph(Oracle oracle,
                             java.lang.String graphName,
                             java.lang.String newGraphName,
                             int dop)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.Exception
        Copy the property graph (including its associated tables) to the specified graph name (if it is not empty). This operation will not copy existing indices into the new graph.
        Parameters:
        oracle - an Oracle connection to the database where the property graph is stored.
        graphName - the name of the property graph to be copied
        newGraphName - the new name of the graph
        dop - the degree of parallelism to use when copying the data from one graph to the other
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • dropPropertyGraph

        public static void dropPropertyGraph(Oracle oracle,
                                     java.lang.String szGraphName)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the specified property graph (including its associated tables). This operation cannot be undone. This method will drop the underlying schema objects for the specified property graph. It will also drop Lucene/SolrCloud index data, if any.
        Parameters:
        oracle - an Oracle connection to the database where the property graph is stored.
        szGraphName - the name of the graph to drop.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • dropPropertyGraphTables

        public static void dropPropertyGraphTables(Oracle oracle,
                                           java.lang.String szGraphName)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the underlying tables of specified property graph (including its associated tables). This operation cannot be undone. Note that this method does not drop Lucene or SolrCloud index data, if any. This method will drop the underlying schema objects for the specified property graph.
        Parameters:
        oracle - an Oracle connection to the database where the property graph is stored.
        szGraphName - the name of the graph to drop.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static final void exportFlatFiles(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                         java.io.OutputStream osVertex,
                                         java.io.OutputStream osEdge,
                                         int dop,
                                         boolean append)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        osVertex - an OutputStream object for the vertex flat file
        osEdge - an OutputStream object for the edge flat file
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat files. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat files removing all existing data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static void exportFlatFiles(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                   java.io.OutputStream osVertex,
                                   java.io.OutputStream osEdge,
                                   int dop,
                                   boolean append,
                                   boolean closeStreams)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        osVertex - an OutputStream object for the vertex flat file
        osEdge - an OutputStream object for the edge flat file
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat files. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat files removing all existing data.
        closeStreams - whether to close the OutputStreams or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static void exportFlatFiles(java.lang.String jdbcUrl,
                                   java.lang.String user,
                                   java.lang.String password,
                                   java.lang.String propertyGraphName,
                                   java.lang.String vertexFileName,
                                   java.lang.String edgeFileName)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                   java.io.IOException,
                                   java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        jdbcUrl - JDBC URL that identifies an Oracle database
        user - username of a database schema
        password - password to authenticate
        propertyGraphName - the name of the property graph to export
        vertexFileName - the name of the vertex flat file e.g. graph.opv
        edgeFileName - the name of the edge flat file e.g. graph.ope
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • prepareTwoTablesGraphEdgeTab

        public static void prepareTwoTablesGraphEdgeTab(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                java.lang.String schema,
                                                java.lang.String edgeTableName,
                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyNames,
                                                java.util.List<PropertyType> propertyTypes,
                                                java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                                                java.lang.String storageOptions,
                                                boolean nologging)
        Creates and prepares an Edge table representing all the edges in a graph using a Two Tables approach. Each column on this table will represent an edge property whose data type is defined by the data type of the column. The size of the table is defined by the given list of property names, plus the columns for edge ID (EID), source vertex (SVID), destination vertex (DVID), and edge label (EL). An edge is stored in a single row including all its Key/value properties. If an edge does not include a given property name, the property value can be set to NULL.
        Parameters:
        conn - a Oracle connection to the database
        schema - the schema where the table will be created (owner)
        edgeTableName - the name of the edge table
        propertyNames - the list of property names that will be used as column names of the table
        propertyTypes - the list of property types that will be used as data types for the columns of the table
        tablespaceName - the tablespace where the table will be created
        storageOptions - the storage options that will be used when creating the table e.g. "COMPACT=T"
        nologging - if logging is enabled

      • readBinaryInMemGraphSnapshot

        public static void readBinaryInMemGraphSnapshot(java.lang.String szGraphName,
                                                java.lang.String tableOwner,
                                                java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                java.io.OutputStream[] os,
                                                long lSnapshotID,
                                                int dop)
                                         throws OraclePropertyGraphException,
                                                java.sql.SQLException
        Reads an In-Memory Graph Snapshot (binary file) from the snapshot SS$ table and writes it into the given outputstream.
        Parameters:
        szGraphName - the graph name where to get the snapshot
        tableOwner - the owner of the snapshot table
        conn - an Oracle connection
        os - an array of OutputStream objects where the in-memory graph binary files will be written.
        lSnapshotID - the ID of the snapshot to read
        dop - the degree of parallelism to use when reading the snapshot
        Throws:
        OraclePropertyGraphException
        java.sql.SQLException
        OraclePropertyGraphException

      • readTwoTablesGraphEdgeAndProperties

        public static java.sql.ResultSet[] readTwoTablesGraphEdgeAndProperties(java.sql.Connection[] conns,
                                                                       java.lang.String schema,
                                                                       java.lang.String edgeTableName,
                                                                       int iTotalSplits,
                                                                       int iStartSplitID)
        Gets an array of ResultSet objects that hold all the edges in the edge (from Two Tables approach). Each element in the ResultSet array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from the corresponding split. The splits are determined by the given # of total splits. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the splits in the vertex table with N splits. The subset of splits queried will consist of those splits with ID value in the range of [startSplitID, startSplit - 1 + size of connections array]. The attributes included in the result set will include the edge information (EID, EL, SVID, DVID), as well as the defined Key/value properties.
        Parameters:
        conns - an array of Oracle connections to the database
        schema - the schema where the table was created (owner)
        edgeTableName - the name of the edge table
        iTotalSplits - the total number of splits
        iStartSplitID - the ID of the starting split.
        Returns:
        a Iterable object.

      • readTwoTablesGraphEdgeAndProperties

        public static java.sql.ResultSet[] readTwoTablesGraphEdgeAndProperties(java.sql.Connection[] conns,
                                                                       java.lang.String schema,
                                                                       java.lang.String edgeTableName,
                                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyNames,
                                                                       int iTotalSplits,
                                                                       int iStartSplitID)
        Gets an array of ResultSet objects that hold all the edges in the edge (from Two Tables approach). Each element in the ResultSet array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from the corresponding split. The splits are determined by the given # of total splits. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the splits in the vertex table with N splits. The subset of splits queried will consist of those splits with ID value in the range of [startSplitID, startSplit - 1 + size of connections array]. The attributes included in the result set will be defined based on the given property names list. If the list is set to NULL, all the columns of the table will be retrieved: this includes the edge information (EID, EL, SVID, DVID), as well as the defined Key/value properties. If the list is set empty, the result set will only include the edge information such as EID, EL, SVID, DVID. In any other case, the result set will include the edge information plus the given list of properties.
        Parameters:
        conns - an array of Oracle connections to the database
        schema - the schema where the table was created (owner)
        edgeTableName - the name of the edge table
        propertyNames - the list of property names to project
        iTotalSplits - the total number of splits
        iStartSplitID - the ID of the starting split.
        Returns:
        a Iterable object.

If the list is set empty, the result set will only include the edge information such as EID, EL, SVID, DVID. In any other case, the result set will include the edge information plus the given list of properties.

      • renameGraph

        public static void renameGraph(Oracle oracle,
                               java.lang.String graphName,
                               java.lang.String newGraphName)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.Exception
        Renames the property graph (including its associated tables) to the specified graph name (if it does not exists or is not empty). This operation will not take into account existing indices. Indices should be removed before calling this operation and re-executed using the new graph instance.
        Parameters:
        oracle - an Oracle connection to the database where the property graph is stored.
        graphName - the name of the property graph to be renamed
        newGraphName - the new name of the property graph.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • renameGraph

        public static void renameGraph(Oracle oracle,
                               java.lang.String graphName,
                               java.lang.String newGraphName,
                               boolean nologging,
                               java.lang.String szOptions)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.Exception
        Renames the property graph (including its associated tables) to the specified graph name (if it does not exists or is not empty). This operation will not take into account existing indices. Indices should be removed before calling this operation and re-executed using the new graph instance.
        Parameters:
        oracle - an Oracle connection to the database where the property graph is stored.
        graphName - the name of the property graph to be renamed
        newGraphName - the new name of the property graph.
        nologging - if logging is enabled on the underlying PL/SQL API.
        szOptions - options to be passed on to the underlying PL/SQL API.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception
